item.description: Literate programming attempt of writing containers

item.description: Building and booting a full distro kernel on qemu for powerpc

item.description: Hack, build, boot kernel on a powerpc using qemu

item.description: Linux kernel and device driver interview questions.

item.title: Call Stack for Beginners - Part 1
item.description: This is part of Life of a Process series, but this one is not an exact continuation of the where it was left, but it should be useful for the overall understanding of a process and its life.

item.title: Debuggin Linux Kernel using JTAG (In ARM)
item.description: Simple and useful steps to debug vmlinux in a JTAG debugger.

item.title: The life of a Process
item.description: This is a series trying to explain the Life of a process in a Linux system. Will try to cover most of the aspects from the user space to the kernel space.

item.title: Emacs org-mode productivity
item.description: Using emacs is awesome, using it also as a productivity tool is so productive. Combined with org-mode emacs and your life will be not the same again.

item.title: You personal computer can be a webserver
item.description: Running a personal webserver from home can be fun, and also keep you busy. Know how to do it.

item.title: Terminal Shortcuts! (Compilation)
item.description: Few shortcuts to enhance your commandline skills
